user-story.i-want: to configure which channels and frequencies I receive platform notifications
user-story.so-that: I stay informed without being overwhelmed.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Notification preferences page renders matrix of notification types (offers, bids, orders, maker activity, security alerts) across email, push, and in-app channels with per-channel toggles. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#implementation-guide]
Quiet hours editor lets users define daily start/end times (local timezone) and disables push/email delivery during that window. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#notification-preferences-entity]
Preferences persist via `notification_manager.dart`, update Firebase topics, and sync to SendGrid suppression groups. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#source-tree--file-directives]
**SECURITY CRITICAL**: Critical security alerts ignore quiet hours and cannot be disabled; UI communicates constraint. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#security-monitoring]
Analytics event `notification_preferences_updated` fires with channel + frequency metadata, and audit trail stored. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-3.md#analytics-events]

task.description: Create `notification_preferences_page.dart` with tabular layout, quiet hours modal, and validation messaging.
Build `notification_channel_row.dart` widget to render per-type channel toggles.
Update `ProfileBloc` to handle `NotificationSettingsSubmitted` event and propagate success/failure states.
Implement `notification_manager.dart` to persist preferences, manage quiet hours, and call Firebase/SendGrid integrations.
Extend `profile_endpoint.dart` with `/notification-preferences` routes and enforce critical alert immutability.
Add integration test `notification_preferences_sync_test.dart` ensuring external services update correctly.
Configure Firebase Cloud Messaging topics per notification type; ensure device tokens stored with opt-in flags.
Map SendGrid categories to notification types and update suppression group IDs in configuration.
